title: Describe a memorable experience when you moved to a new place.

korean: 작년에 이사했을 때가 진짜 힘들었어, 생각만 해도 피곤해.
이사 업체 부르기 전에 짐 정리하는 게 제일 큰일이더라고.
오래 살았던 집이라 물건이 엄청 많았는데, 버릴 게 반이었어.
안 쓰는 물건들 정리하면서 추억 여행 하느라 시간이 더 걸렸어.
이사 당일에 업체 사람들이 오전 8시에 왔는데, 나도 일찍 일어나야 했어.
짐 싸는 거 보니까 진짜 프로답더라고, 빠르고 정확해.
트럭에 짐 싣는 것도 금방이더라, 나는 그냥 구경만 했어.
새 집에 도착해서 짐 풀 때가 제일 막막했어, 어디서부터 시작해야 할지.
일단 침대부터 설치하고, 그날 밤은 박스 사이에서 잤어.
며칠 동안 짐 정리하느라 주말을 다 써버렸어, 힘들었지만 보람 있었어.
새 집에 적응하는 데 한 달 정도 걸린 것 같아.
지금은 완전 적응했고, 이사 잘했다는 생각이 들어.
english: Well, when I moved last year, it was, like, really tough, you know, just thinking about it makes me tired.
Before calling the moving company, organizing my stuff was basically the biggest task.
I mean, I'd lived in the old place for a long time, so there was, like, tons of stuff, and half of it needed to be thrown away.
While sorting through things I didn't use, I, you know, took a trip down memory lane, which took even more time.
On moving day, the movers came at 8 AM, so, well, I had to wake up early too.
Watching them pack, they were, like, real professionals, you know, fast and precise.
Loading the truck was pretty quick too, I just, um, watched.
When we arrived at the new place and it was time to unpack, that's when I felt most overwhelmed, like, not knowing where to start.
I set up the bed first, and that night I actually slept among the boxes.
I spent the whole weekend unpacking for several days, and, well, it was hard but rewarding.
I think it took about a month to, you know, get used to the new place.
Now I'm completely settled in, and, like, I think the move was a good decision.
